metadata.title: CVE-2021-47109 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:neighbour: allow NUD_NOARP entries to be forced GCed IFF_POINTOPOINTinterfaces use NUD_NOARP entries for IPv6. It's possible to fill up theneighbour table with enough entries that it will overflow for validconnections after that. This behaviour is more prevalent after commit58956317c8de ("neighbor: Improve garbage collection") is applied, as itprevents removal from entries that are not NUD_FAILED, unless they are morethan 5s old.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
